definition: can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])

sentences.english: Do you think this year's District Council Election was corruption-free?
sentences.chinese: 你认为今届区议会选举系唔系廉洁咁进行？

sentences.english: Mr Tung said the District Council appointment system cannot be abandoned suddenly.
sentences.chinese: 董建华表示不能一下子全面撤消区议会委任制。

sentences.english: Democratic Party members walked out of Legco in protest at the retention of appointed seats in the district councils.
sentences.chinese: 民主党不满区议会保留委任制愤然拉队离场抗议。

sentences.english: County Council Campania Dinosaur Exhibition 2010 International Motorcycle.
sentences.chinese: 坎帕格纳暴龙在2010年区议会国际摩托车展。

sentences.english: This year district council members and academics were invited.
sentences.chinese: 本年更邀请了区议会议员及学术界人士。

sentences.english: Mr tung said the district council appointment system cannot be abandoned suddenly.
sentences.chinese: 董建华表示不能一下子全面撤销区议会委任制。

definition: abbr. for 民主建港協進聯盟|民主建港协进联盟, Democratic alliance for the betterment of Hong Kong (DAB), Hong Kong pro-Beijing party
Carrie Lam (1957-), chief executive of Hong Kong 2017-, full name 林鄭月娥|林郑月娥[Lin2 Zheng4 Yue4 e2] Carrie Lam Cheng Yuet-ngor
lower chamber (of legislative body)/lower house/the House of Commons
British Columbia, province of Canada (loanword from "BC")
seat in a parliament or legislative assembly
chief executive of Special Administrative Region (Hong Kong or Macao)/abbr. for 特別行政區首席執行官|特别行政区首席执行官
